website_summaries.verdict: This powerful flashlight not only delivers 1000 lumens of light, but is built to stand up to heavy-duty use.
pros: Features 3 light levels, strobe, and SOS mode
Focus is adjustable, and rugged construction is waterproof
Earns praise from professionals including military veterans for its light and build
cons: It has the tendency to drain battery power fairly quickly with constant use, and the light dims a bit as the power decreases

customer_reviews.title: High light output. Typical Fenix high quality.  Combine with good batteries and charger--see below for proven recommendations:
customer_reviews.text: Typical Fenix high quality. Have purchased several of different models; my favorite is the PD-35 series--have bought four over several years. This latest is the highest output, and significantly, features a superior LED. Unlike the previous (2014?) model which had a conspicuous yellow halo around the light beam striking an object, the 2015 has a clean beam of all one color temperature--I'd guess somewhere between 4000 and 5000 Kelvin. Just make sure you purchase with superior batteries and a charger, both available on Amazon: Orbtronic 3200 mAhr 18650 protected lithium ion rechargeable (yes, they're worth the $$ in reduced fire hazard and increased life)  Nitecore D4 controlled charger
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: 1000 Lumens is Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Fenix. My other flashlights are Sure Fire (very good, but much more expensive), plus Shadowhawk (Tactical). This Fenix is easily the strongest (1000 lumens), best made, and least expensive. The back button can turn the light on temporarily with a half-press, or with a full-press / click, permanently. It uses the same batteries as the Sure Fire. Love this flashlight!
customer_reviews.author: John A. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck when it comes to EDC lights.
customer_reviews.text: This light is absolutely phenomenal. It's not too big for me to EDC using the pocket clip, and rarely does a day go by that I don't find myself using the light. The varying brightness settings makes it useful for all but the most demanding applications, the strobe setting has come in handy as a makeshift safety light while bicycling, and the design is extremely sturdy. Buy this light and carry it on your person, and your quality of life will improve. The ability to whip an ultra-bright flashlight out of your pocket in an instant is life-changing. If you have an active lifestyle, you'll be using this constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson R.

customer_reviews.title: This flashlight is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Was searching for a flashlight for hunting, after reading many reviews I settled on this flashlight. Glad I did. This light is every bit as bright as it claims. Lasts about an hour on turbo using an Orbtronic 3500mah 18650 battery. Pair this with a good headlamp and you'll look like a car driving through the woods...
customer_reviews.author: dersom

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 45 days
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a couple minutes each day for a month. Stopped working, recharged battery, same result. Garbage. Will try and work with Fenix warranty but if I were to buy again would purchase direct from manufacturer. Recommend lighting $1 bills on fire for more affordable source of light. Purchased from J&M World Wide Products, Inc. seller on amazon. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: ClarkAmazon

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed.... I’ve boight these before and got batteries with them. This one has no batteries and the box was a little jacked up like it’s a return that’s been resold
customer_reviews.author: Shawn D.

customer_reviews.title: I wear this on my belt at work at the Fire dept its that good
customer_reviews.text: Another quality light from Fenix, I use this at work in a public safety job and rely on it, it just performs well every day. Battery life is surprisingly long. Beam is smooth. Output and tint are amazing, I just shine the ceiling on high indoors and it's like someone turned on the lights!
customer_reviews.author: WJK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent light for the money....I have 3 Fenix products that are duty lights. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: VanillaGorilla

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have a spare, and kept it in the box until today. The function button does not do anything. The light works, but can't change the brightness. I should have tried it when I first purchased, and the return window closed a week ago. My fault for not checking it out when I first got it, but for $66 bucks you expect it to work. This is the second Fenix that has been bad... Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Brickkicker

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfaction with 3rd purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd fx-pd35tac to purchase. The other 2 have worked without any problems. This one I just opened today and has issues. It changes between modes on it own. Changes when you move it around. Changes modes of it bumps something. Have been disappointed in this 3rd purchase. Will give an update if and when I hear back from the company. Amazon said I was out of my purchase guarantee and had to deal with the company directly for warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Guaranteed to break
customer_reviews.text: I am on my 2nd Fenix and am now moving to Streamlight. Basically, after a year, the light will no longer turn on. I know its a bad internal connection because, if I tap it, the light will blink. This is the exact same problem I had with my first one and decided to get a second to see if I have better luck. After 1 year on each, forget it. Time to move on.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Glickman

customer_reviews.title: Fenix does not include batteries in package.
customer_reviews.text: Imagine ordering this for a loved one because you are so happy with your previous Fenix purchase. When it arrives, it includes zero batteries, and the ones that it requires are not your standard household batteries. We had to order new batteries with dedicated charger and wait a week before the gift receiver could use it. Since these require specialized batteries for a first-time "good" flashlight user, Fenix should at least include some cheapo ones in the box so that it's usable right away.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lam

customer_reviews.title: Fake Item
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to my first Fenix PD35 but instead received a cheap knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Laveen

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Stop working on anything but the lowest setting already. Now it’s just expensive piece of junk. Found out the batteries were gone in. New batteries and it works fine again. Problem is I haven’t hardly used it yet. Certainly hasn’t lasted nearly as long as advertised even if it was on the high setting. Can’t depend on it. Nice expensive novelty light. Make sure you have extra batteries on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not rechargeable flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Flashlight was nice and durable. But it is not a rechargeable flashlight. If you're using this on a daily basis, you will go through batteries so fast. Not worth it. I ended up buying a more expensive flashlight that was rechargeable. It has saved me so much on batteries already. This was a good flashlight but I wouldn't recommend it for daily users.
customer_reviews.author: G Carr

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Just an incredible light for the money. I have owned many lights, but for the money, this is the best for me. I'm an auto tech, so I drop lights from 6ft and above often, and I have not killed one of these yet. I think the thrunite light is the best "bang for the buck" but they die when they are dropped from 4ft and above. Get this light if you are rougher on the lights. It is just perfect, for the money. A perfect "all around" light imo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a year
customer_reviews.text: First, I tried looking up the number for the manufacturer but they say on their website they are not answering phone calls. I’ve had this flashlight less than a year and it is already not functioning correctly. It has several brightness settings, but defaults to the lowest setting after several seconds. Without being able to call the company I refuse to plow any more money into this. It could be the battery, or the charger?? Very disappointing for such a pricey item.
customer_reviews.author: JFW

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with batteries
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with batteries. Nowhere is it stated that it wouldn't come with them. You'll get a better deal ordering from someone else that will include them.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Not a 1000 lumen light photo on left is Fenix beam photo on rt is Streamlight beam
customer_reviews.text: My Department issued Streamlight Strion light is almost as bright as this light. That is rated at 300+ lumens and this is rated at 1000. No way this is 1000. Fenix lied about the lumens. This light also seems a little cheaply made. I am returning it for a refund and will purchase the Streamlight Strion High Output. Pros are that it is a compact light and it smaller than above light. Also, no 18650 battery included. (which I knew about from the description)
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you read carefully. Does not come with batteries.
customer_reviews.text: This might be a great light. I don't know yet because my order didn't come with batteries. Make sure you read carefully! I did not read carefully. I thought I was saving money but now I have to spend more to get a battery and charger. For a dollar more you can get this one that comes with batteries.  For ten bucks more you can this one with batteries and a charge cord.  I'm sure the light is great as evidenced by the other reviews. I just wanted to warn folks to not make the same dumb mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: SlabOMeat

customer_reviews.title: Super bright/light weight
customer_reviews.text: Love this flashlight! It is ridiculously bright but you can adjust it for what you need. I work in law enforcement and the low light mode helps to not blind people but the high 1000 lumens lights up the darkest places especially on search’s. 5 stars all around; 4 on the battery life simply because I’m not sure how long the batteries will last. The only down side? Fits perfectly in my flashlight holder but it slides straight through. It the top of the flashlight was wider it would fit better but I can always put it in my pocket. Love this flashlight. Hands down the best I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.author: Guardian Angel

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the Fenix lights. They are just perfect for whatever you need a light for. We carry them when we go out at night, and around the house for home defense. A quality tool that has not let us down. The output is controllable, the battery lasts a looong time between charges. Be aware that the highest lumen setting is powerful enough to destroy the night vision of an intruder and yourself, if you shine it on something reflective. The "tactical mode" allows the small button on the front to control the output and cycles through the various levels and strobe mode. Very quick and easy to adjust it just right for the situation.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 5701

customer_reviews.title: So Amazing I Immediately Bought Another
customer_reviews.text: Holy Cow! I've used a Stinger DS LED for many years on patrol, but decided to check out the smaller/newer generation flashlights. This PD35TAC makes my Stinger look anemic, although the stinger does have a more focused beam. That isn't as important to me, however, because subjects/objects which need to be illuminated are typically relatively close, not 100 yards away. This flashlight is so powerful and light, coupled with a good holster found on Amazon, I immediately ordered a second for off-duty carry. You will not be disappointed in this flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for your emergency kit or walking the dog
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these things scattered around the house for when the lights go out, plus one for walking the dog. They are much brighter than ones three times as big. I like that I can just stick it in my pocket. It has adjustable dimness levels so you don't blind passersby. I did a lot of research and these are the best flashlights out there.
customer_reviews.author: ETG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Flashlight---great for women walking alone!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new flashlight for dog walking at night (my house backs up to a greenbelt and there are all sorts of critters in my back yard once the sun goes down). I was using a mag light, but it wasn't strong enough to light up my bushes in the back. I ended up randomly talking to a guy who was in the police academy and he recommended this flashlight. It was super spendy, but WELL worth it! This thing lights up the world! I started carrying it when I go out at night and it really makes me feel safe. LOVE THIS! Great for use around the house, but I would recommend it for all women.
customer_reviews.author: JP Cooks in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Fist off, it's really annoying that batteries aren't included. Second of all, when I got batteries, the flashlight does not work. I learned my lesson. Stick to American made, I'm buying a Maglite instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket sized tactlight, but get ready to spend some money.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best flashlights I've ever own. It is very bright, has different brightness and flash settings, and seems to be well made. It's a bit pricey though, but if you're looking for a tactlight that's made to last you will definitely have to spend some money. The cheaper tactlights sold online won't last long under regular use. Only downfall on this tactlight is that the head gets a bit hot after long use on the high beam setting. So make sure not to leave the tactlight on for too long, or leave it near flammable items while the tactlight has been in use for a long time to prevent a fire.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: One star off for deceptive bullet point in description
customer_reviews.text: Have only had this light for a few weeks, but was disappointed with the fact that the VERY FIRST line of the product description says "Made in the USA or imported" (whatever that means). When, in fact, every last bit of Fenix is Chinese. I purchased several accessories (bike mount, gun mount, filter, charger)... all made in China. The quality of the light seems good, so that's certainly important. But once again Amazon fails to police their vendors to keep them honest.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Flashlight in a Small Package
customer_reviews.text: I was a police officer for over 30 years and I originally bought this flashlight because a number of my friends had bought one and they all swore by it. I now own three of them, one for my bedside table and one in the console of each of our cars. I've also bought one for each of my now-grown kids and they all love them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Copper

customer_reviews.title: Fenix Customer For Life!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I ever worked without this light years ago. The quality is refined, simply excellent. Paired up with the top notch recommended lithium ion Orbtronic batteries, and you've got yourself a light so strong, you can incapacitate someone if you point this at their eyes with all 1,000 lumens. The button on the side allows for 4 output settings, the lowest of which is perfect when you need minimal light, and the highest of which could probably be seen from space. Amazing coming from such a small unit, get yourself a good case to protect it!
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: A good light for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This flashlight is very good, very solid, and made very well. The only part that seems a little sub standard is the side button which is your Mode selector. Although it works well, it seems to be the cheapest piece of plastic on this entire flashlight. Overall, that is a very minor concern. The most important thing is that the flashlight works well and has different modes and levels of brightness. The different modes work well, and the strobe is easy to access. Overall, I’m very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: This little light of mine..
customer_reviews.text: I have (and still use) the previous generation of PD35 in addition to this one. Battery life even with daily use at work and on dog walks is exceptional with the Fenix 3400 mah batteries.. This one is noticeably brighter than the 900 lumen earlier model, while retaining all of the positive features. The tail cap switch for on-off is much better than their multifunction mode select/power switch on other models. Super bright, exceptional beam distance with minimal scatter.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ammerman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome spotlight
customer_reviews.text: This has become my favorite EDC flashlight. I usually use it in the low mode because its so bright but when the dogs are barking out back at night and I need a quick way to see what's out in the trees, I put this on 1000 lumen output and wow. Lights up the whole back yard. I've been super impressed with this flashlight especially for the price. If I could, I'd give it six stars...
customer_reviews.author: MaineWolf

customer_reviews.title: Great light, but overheats quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely bright and does the job. My one concern and I'm not sure if other people have noticed this, but it heats up extremely fast, took the batteries out to check them, could barely touch them. Concerned this could cause the batteries to explode from overheating if light is left on to long. I also bought the recommended batteries.
customer_reviews.author: pork&beanz

customer_reviews.title: I loved it, after 3 days of getting it I ...
customer_reviews.text: At first it was a very reliable, very bright flash light. I loved it, after 3 days of getting it I put it on tactical mode and it wouldn’t come off of it. Then the battery just died, so I went to get a battery charger and that fixed everything or so I thought. 2 weeks later the flashlight would stay on and start to flicker and it would shut off. Very bright but not reliable. Would not recommend only because it is not dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Good flashlight
customer_reviews.text: It is a little expensive compared to other flashlights. I use it everyday and a charge lasts about 3 weeks or so when the battery hits 50%. My only complaint is the recharge takes all day. So I ended up ordering another battery (which is also expensive) because I couldn't find this type at the local hardware/big box store. I now rotate batteries because when I need a flashlight at work , I need it.
customer_reviews.author: techspider

customer_reviews.title: One tough light
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding flashlight. It has held up to any abuse I throw at it. It’s been dropped, banged around and subjecting to extreme temperatures. I used this for a while at work which where I work means furnaces and extremely high temperatures. I used as a weapon light for a while and recoil didn’t harm it. After I wanted to carry it again I realized I lost the end cap and Fenix replaced it for me. It’s very bright and definitely easy to carry. I can’t recommend this light enough.
customer_reviews.author: PtrkG

customer_reviews.title: Love this flashlight.
customer_reviews.text: Having a daily carry flashlight has been important to me. I needed something that would perform and last, not just in duration of light but also the quality. I seem to have finally found this one. It is not too expensive, small, great quality, has all the features that I would want or need, easy to use, provide plenty of light, multiple settings to control the brightness, and provide light at a duration that will be suitable for all my needs. Using the recommended batteries, this flashlight has made me extremely happy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bayliss

customer_reviews.title: Better than SureFire E2D at 1/3 the price
customer_reviews.text: Owned many Surefire flashlights and weapon lights. The E2D Defender was my everyday carry for dog-walking at night. This Fenix PD-35 TAC is a better light in every way. Beam pattern, brightness, more modes, including strobe. will take 2x CR123 batteries or 1x 18650 high output rechargeable battery that does not fit into the Surefire. I like this Fenix so much, I bought another dedicated to my car, and two others as gifts to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: Disposable flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Don’t worry about rechargeable batteries, the regular batteries work just fine. You’ll only need the one set though as the batteries will outlast the flashlight and you’ll get no warranty support from the seller or Fenix.
customer_reviews.author: TBoomDiggityJ

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working Within the First Year
customer_reviews.text: The flashlight quit working within the first years. Changed the batteries twice and still did not work. I will move to a different brand for its replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Rue1960

customer_reviews.title: Whites out smart phone cameras in broad daylight!
customer_reviews.text: Coworker has one. After trying it, had to buy one. Low profile so doesnt snag my vest when in holster on my belt. Whites out cell phone cameras even in broad daylight. Get a good 120v AC charger. The usb ones dont provide enough power to properly charge the 18650 batts.
customer_reviews.author: N8

customer_reviews.title: A robust tank at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 Fenix flashlights, 3 handheld, 1 headlamp. They all work fantastically, they are very robust ( I work on a oil & gas drilling rig and have dropped them multiple times with no issues.) Infact I dropped a PD35 in a shaker bin ( large tub holds 4000 gallons fluid) that had oil based mud in it (diesel mixed with thicken agents to raise its overall weight per gallon). Basically it’s used motor oil. After 30 very tense minutes I was able to retrievie the light, it was fine, wiped it off, sprayed it down with pressure washer, all good. It was still shinning bright as ever! I’m not sure there is much more I need to say.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Davis

customer_reviews.title: One of the times you DONT want to go into the light..
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly badass flash light and well worth the price. I got one for my boyfriend last week and he LOVES it. He works on appliances and uses it to look in the crevaces behind counters and up inside refrigerator guts and the like. It's so powerful that if you hold it against a single spot for a minute or two, it can melt through plastic cups and singe carpets. Not that we ever did that... (We did). Definitely recommended. Big time. A lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Opt for the version that comes with batteries and a charger it’s definitely worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: So I want to give this five stars badly its incredible bright, light weight and useful. I wish I had one of these back in my EMS ambulance days. However the fact that this doesn't come with a battery. Is irritating as hell and trying to track down the correct ones weren’t the easiest to find as well. I have noticed since thats some have a battery and charger included for an additional price and if I had seen that I would have definitely gone with that option knowing what I know now.
customer_reviews.author: EMThollywood13

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best
customer_reviews.text: I've owned and carried several quality flashlights, Maglite, Streamlight, Pelican, but the Fenix PD35 TAC is hands down the best flashlight I've ever owned. I use it on Outdoor mode exclusively and the memory feature is fantastic. Invest in some good 18650 batteries, I recommend 3500 mAh, and will have a very versatile, bright, and dependable light. I own three of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Shane

customer_reviews.title: No batteries included- huge mistake
customer_reviews.text: A huge disappointment! No batteries included.. I should have read previous ratings and avoided a $60 door stop.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Contrlols are third rate trash.
customer_reviews.text: flashlight is constantly shifting between different brightness's to SOS flashing to strobe without touching controls. This flashlight controls feel and act cheaply made. Even though flashlight itself feels solid I wouldn't pay more than a dollar for it and then only to give it as a toy for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line! Update on quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice light! All one size from one end to the next. Nice case as well. Bought the Helotex G4 as well. Both identical in brightness. The G4 is easier to use due to less functions. One button does it all. But I like the 5 levels of of brightness on the Fenix. Both strobes identical. The G4 is considerably less expensive but has a wider head. Both lights are heavy duty materials. I will keep both! Update on the Fenix light: Bought in August 2016. The light power level button quit working 12/2016. Return process is directly to the manufacturer in China at your expense.
customer_reviews.author: Dbosse

customer_reviews.title: stunning flashlight, quite literally
customer_reviews.text: I cant find anything wrong with this flashlight, its an amazing one that is for sure. I love to collect flashlights and knives, and have quite a few fenix lights, this one I enjoy the most. +1 for weight +1 for grip +1 for battery consumption + 1 for the back up rings, and extras including holster +1 for THE BRIGHTNESSSSSS >.< my eyeees Only -1 for the fact that they could have made the tac mode a little bit less confusing to get in and out of. I've had it for a bit, followed the instructions, and still cant get a handle of it.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Lee

customer_reviews.title: What a beam! This flashlight is guaranteed to put light where you need it.
customer_reviews.text: Is it cheap? Nope Is it inexpensive? Nope Is it worth every penny it costs? Oh yes it sure does I have used this light on my motorcycle, my car and even behind my computer to get light where I needed it. And it has yet to let me down. You can dim the light as well so it is not over bearing for the job you need. I would be confident telling anyone to purchase this flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: ROB n VICKI

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I've been eyeing on this for quite a while now and I've finally picked it up. The flashlight is plain awesome. I owned a Maglight and to compare with Fenix Tac PD 35, it doesn't do any justice. I love how bright it gives out and the best part is... it's very lightweight. It does not come with batteries which are not a problem for me since I own a few 18650s. I was hoping it came with a holster and that it did. Overall, I'm very happy with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Upgrade that keeps up the reliability
customer_reviews.text: Bought the PD35 Tac Edition to replace an aging PD35 original for EDC. Tactical mode is useful, but come on Fenix- give us a firefly mode/ ultra-low-lumen mode already. Get this flashlight if you want something that is reliable. I have Nitecores and Thrunites that both decide they'd rather save my batteries than emit light when I ask for it- great flashlights but NOT something I want to deal with in an emergency. This light WILL turn on if the batteries feed it. Mind blowing concept, right? Fenix, firefly mode. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: S. Serbousek

customer_reviews.title: Great flashlight - check battery size!
customer_reviews.text: Great flashlight - check out the battery requirements though before you purchase. I looked too quickly thinking this ran on AAs. Nope, runs on a wired size. Still totally worth it though - nice bright,compact flashlight. I like how it has a dimmer/softer light mode for when your inside a small space. Keeps you from blinding yourself with its normally high powered light beam.
customer_reviews.author: Marc G.

customer_reviews.title: I can’t imagine needing anything brighter.
customer_reviews.text: Whoa! These lights are awesome. I have a few. One I keep on my tool belt along side of a lessor light. When I need daylight in a dark area I use this. It’s so freaking bright on the high setting I usually use the dimmer modes except when I want to wow my buddies on camping trips. This little light is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Really glad I bought this flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Just got this flashlight today, and took out outside to test it. Very impressive! It lights up my entire back yard. I can't imagine ever needing more light than this puts out. Can't comment on the battery life since I just got it, but I'm sure it's dependant on how you use the light.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great light for officers
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely impressed by this light. I was sceptical at first but my first call with this light was an EMS call with a guy in a car, 2 other officers had their lights on in the car before I got there. Once my light came on both theirs were useless because of how bright this was. I also like that to change the light and strobe feature there is a button near the top rather than so many other lights all use 1 Button which is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for caves and night walks.
customer_reviews.text: Better than Streamlight pro tac HLX with is another 1000 lumen 2 battery CR123 flashlight. The Fenix is a better value and same quality, the bezel does not flare out and the battery life is longer. Only complaint is the pocket clip. Unleashed dogs will also leave you alone.
customer_reviews.author: Liam O'Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Bright AF
customer_reviews.text: I love this flashlight! This is the second one I have bought off Amazon. Its so bright its blinding. I love all the settings and that it is water proof. It's basically the only torch you will ever need. Even though its a little bulky, I use it as an every-day-carry (EDC) and I love it. Can be used for self defense as well if you are in a pinch. It has strobe feature to stun attackers and is super hard so it can be held in your fist and used to pound hammerfist style.
customer_reviews.author: the Mindful Wanderers

customer_reviews.title: I may have used this light 5 times in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I may have used this light 5 times in a 2 month period, and it no longer works. I took it hiking and when I needed it most, it lit up for a second and then went out. I replaced the battery to no avail. No number or way to return it. Very bright when it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truth
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a flashlight geek, I don’t have tools to measure lumens and I’m not an electrical engineer, but honest, as a recent buyer of both the Thrunite TN and this Fenix, I can tell you w absolute certainty that the Fenix is brighter and shines further. I put freshly charged Orbtronic batteries in both flashlights, Fenix is definitely a brighter unit. That being said, the Thrunite is an excellent light also, I like it a lot, but for pure brightness and lumination, Fenix has it beat.
customer_reviews.author: KRS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small flashlight
customer_reviews.text: This flashlight is great for home or outdoors. Having multiple brightness settings is useful, and a single button accesses those different settings easily and quickly. Its small size makes it easy to store whether in a drawer at home or in a backpack out doors. Its brightest settings are very bright and provide good areal coverage. It's built to last as well. Best way to describe this flashlight is to say it meets all the all its product descriptions very well.
customer_reviews.author: BWB

customer_reviews.title: Good but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: The flashlight works fine, the beam is a nice neutral white and has a good amount of spill. I like that you can switch between outdoor and tactical modes. It would be 5 stars if not for the price - since my Atactical A1S is nearly as good and comes with a rechargeable battery, all the while being less than half the price of the PD35TAC.
customer_reviews.author: randir14

customer_reviews.title: Second PD35Tac with issues
customer_reviews.text: This is the second PD35Tac I have bought and they have both come with lighting issues. I have contacted the company (pretty good response time and very helpful) and have gone through the troubleshooting instructions. The main issue is the light is not bright enough. I have have had a LD22 and I love it. I did try different batteries and the power on the PD35Tac was not bright enough. After talking to a customer service representative from Fenix, I purchased a LD30 and it works great. My recommendation is to buy the LD30 or another Fenix product as it appears this model may have some issues.
customer_reviews.author: Lcova

customer_reviews.title: Batteries not included
customer_reviews.text: I could not wait to open and use the flashlight and (not so quickly) determined I needed specialized batteries not included in the box. I have ordered a recharger and batteries at an additional $22. I can't recall if I was advised on Amazon the "folks who buy this item also purchase...batteries". Only 2 more days and I can actually try and rate the flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: Jihall

customer_reviews.title: Batteries not included & buttons do not function
customer_reviews.text: When buying from REI for example , they include a set of batteries inside the box. This came with none and the button that controls the beam intensity does not function.
customer_reviews.author: christian s.

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light. It's super tough and well designed. It's pretty compact which is a feature I really like. I dont notice that it's on me and it has a tight clip so I never have to worry about it slipping out and getting lost. This was a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t forget batteries! 2 of the same flashlights posted 1 with and 1 without batteries
customer_reviews.text: My last light was great lasted 4 years until I dropped it in a lake. This one I don’t know yet because it came with No batteries for an expensive light. Now I have to find and order them.
customer_reviews.author: Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Best little light ever.
customer_reviews.text: By far the best edc light on the market. Super bright and reliable. I have two of these already, one mounted to my self defense option(wink) and the other in my pocket. Because of the reliability, brightness, and great design I have just ordered three more to give to my wife, daughter, and son. I would easily pay over $100 for this light. At $60 you can’t beat this little workhorse. Outstanding product at an exceptional price. Honest review from an honest customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1000 Lumens?? Not A Chance!
customer_reviews.text: This is not 1000 lumens by any stretch of the imagination. I was actually anticipating the arrival of this little flashlight based on the reviews here on Amazon yet, this has been one of the few times I’ve been thoroughly disappointed in the product I received. Look elsewhere if you’re looking for a true 1000 lm flashlight...
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: VERY Bright.  Compact
customer_reviews.text: I strongly endorse. I've bought several different tactical lights; this light is best. VERY bright. Nice and compact. When looking online for a tactical flashlight, one always is skeptical about the lumens rating. So many vendors claim 1,000 lumens. I believe this one really is 1,000 lumens. It's way more bright than the less expensive I have bought. BTW, I was surprised at first that the beam is fixed. No adjustment. But it doesn't need it. It's brightness makes the focus function unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Williams

customer_reviews.title: nice little light
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of the light and the brightness but it zaps the battery very quickly on high. I didn't like the fact that it doesn't come with a battery or charger. I bought 6 of these for Christmas gifts. So I guess we will see how everyone likes their gift.
customer_reviews.author: AirplaneBlaine

customer_reviews.title: Great flashlight, just keep the rubber switch intact.
customer_reviews.text: This flashlight is very high quality as you'd expect and extremely bright. Just keep it away from teething children. My 1-year-old son is in a climbing phase and got a hold of it and chewed the rubber switch off, and now I click it on and it doesn't work. That little rubber piece is a very important function of the unit. I'll be ordering another one, though.
customer_reviews.author: Garry

customer_reviews.title: Great carry light
customer_reviews.text: I have been carrying this daily for a few months now. It's as bright as you'll ever need for a carry light! The strobe is very easy to activate, though I would suggest practicing just to be able to do it with muscle memory, as you do need to double tap the tail switch to strobe. I got a Fenix 2600 mAh rechargeable lithium ion battery to use with it.
customer_reviews.author: Van Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Wow, This Is Bright
customer_reviews.text: I can't yet speak to durability, but this is BRIGHT. I bought a PD30 six years ago for about the same price, and it was great; still is. The tech must have evolved quite a bit since then though. This was a fantastic purchase, and if durability proves to be an issue, I'll come back to update this. It feels similar in quality though, so I don't expect that to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: zombilex

customer_reviews.title: No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Flashlight. Well made and exactly as described. Has a light mode for just about everything. 3500mah fenix battery last a very long time in this flashlight. If you use a flashlight on the regular for anything, you can't go wrong with this one, it will be there working as it should when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best flashlight I’ve had (if only I had a battery)
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this flashlight for several months now for work and am v impressed. Hasn’t failed me once, and the charge lasts a long time. I use it with orbtronic 3500 mAH batteries and an XTAR charger. Cannot recommend enough! Update: I lost my flashlight in an attic so I had to buy another one. I bought one that DID NOT come with a flashlight. You should make that more clear! I can’t even find the right battery available on Amazon now. Boo!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Warning NO BATTERY INCLUDED
customer_reviews.text: GREAT flashlight. Expensive but great. Rechargeable batteries are EXPENSIVE!! Get the rechargeable one. It comes with battery and recharging cord! Much better value and more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Matilda

customer_reviews.title: Still amazing and looks like new after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Used this during the hurricanes last year. I have had it for a while and I protect it with my own life!!! Get some rechargeable batteries and you're good to go. It surprises everyone with how bright it is. Druing the hurricanes, I was posted at a shelter as their EMS crew. The LEO there had a beast of a MagLight, but my little Fenix could light up the entire courtyard of the school. The officers was just more focused of a beam.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Wayne Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Fenix Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding flashlight. I have other LED flashlights but the "bump" the switch to turn on feature is nice. Fully depressed and the light will stay on. the "bump" the switch feature is a must for use with a home protection device. 1000 lumens is an overkill but the other brand that I was going to buy was 40 USD more at 600 lumens. Nice and thin.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Another flash light....
customer_reviews.text: This light has some good value, it is very bright, the features worked on mine. Buttons feel solid, time will tell if they hold up. Really the only con that I have is the "special" Lithium battery 18650. It's not an issue, just have to get a battery and charger. Something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Travis L.

customer_reviews.title: Beats my fenix pd32
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a fenix fan since I’ve owned my first fenix which was the E20. I’ve owned many fenix flashlights such as the fenix pd32 fenix e20 fenix tk15 and they are all amazing lights in their own aspect and features. For the this lights to have the lumens you have is amazing the runtimes are amazing
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Good flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Still one of my favorites. I've haven't been easy on this flashlight drop it every day, submurising it in water daily. I left it on on in a freeze for at least 2 hours. The only reason I bought a new one I lost my first one after 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright Light and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: The Fenix is a compact flashlight that packs plenty of light. As it is for emergencies, I have only used it a few times. I keep it by the night stand and occasionally test it to make sure it works.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Iglesias

customer_reviews.title: The best light all around!
customer_reviews.text: The best light! I have 5. One on my ar, one on my ak, one on my nightstand, one I carry, and one for my wife. I've abused and literally beaten these into the concrete repeatedly to demo for friends how tough it is. Never had it even flickered. No toggling through the settings, because it has a memory, which is very important. Also, monetary on is a giant plus. No reason to buy any other light.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Benware

customer_reviews.title: Get one. You wont regret it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice flashlight. For the price, you can't go wrong. I'm not taking any of my flashlights in a war zone, but I can say for reliable home defense light, without breaking the bank, this is perfect. I've used it on my 12ga, 308 and my 762x39. Still kicking butt. The light programming is a little funky. If you can read, you'll be fine though. I guess you wouldn't be reading this if you couldn't read. If you can't read. Dont get this flashlight. Spend the money on a tutor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fenix Flashlight is the best ever.
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while to write this review to give me time to actually review it. I love the sharp bright light. I don't use the strobe so I can't speak to that. I use this to walk my dog in a very rural area. I do recharge the batteries every few days. It does NOTcome with a battery charger so you'll need to buy that separately.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Best flashlight for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Greatest flashlight I own. I only buy Felix now and gave away all my surefires. Recharable batteries and 1000 lumens? Yes please. When you use this flashlight every one around will say wow what a bright flashlight. You’ll have anyone with a nice flashlight making battery excuses as to why there’s isn’t as bright as it normally is.
customer_reviews.author: ᛏᛟᚦ

customer_reviews.title: brightest light function does not last
customer_reviews.text: as in other reviews, this flashlight will not work on the brightest setting after a short period of time. just long enough to be out of the timeframe for return. most of mine was eaten up as it was a Christmas gift. this was not taken into consideration...costly mistake
customer_reviews.author: Tra

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Product
customer_reviews.text: This is one awesome torch. Bought it to upgrade my lighting on camping/RV trips. The construction is solid...very high quality. And the amount of illumination is phenomenal for such a small unit.. This torch produces ten (or more) times the lumens of my old "MagLite" at a tiny fraction of the size and weight. Controls are simple and intuitive...the selection of modes is excellent. Also like the ability to operate this torch using one 18650 battery or two CR123A batteries.
customer_reviews.author: William Thee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect EDC Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: A plenty bright and sturdy flashlight. Perfect for EDC. 1000 lumens makes this essentially overkill in all situations. The option to set the brightness will of course extend battery life which is why I gave it a five star in that category. Still, make no mistake your battery selection can help with this a lot. Splurge a little and buy yourself a Samsung lithium cell.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Stegman

customer_reviews.title: Decent flash light but the on off button is to ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent flash light but the on off button is to big. While carting it in its holster it came with, power button was accidentally pushed and melted a hole in top of holster (see picture) and started melting my shirt and blistering my side before I know it was on. Now when I’m done using it, I turn it to low before placing it in its holster.
customer_reviews.author: rcflyerjr

customer_reviews.title: Best flashlight on the market
customer_reviews.text: I am in the army and this flashlight is amazing can easily see 2-300 ft in pitch black wilderness and also can equip a red lenses which makes it good for a tactical environment.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome flashlight... crazy bright and very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome flashlight... crazy bright and very durable. The dual switch set up is very convenient, allowing you to configure easily for various needs, while leaving the last used setting readily useable without having to select through other options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I was pushed and pushed to get a Streamlight, but I went with Fenix because I liked the features & design better...and I was NOT disappointed when I got it. Ended up buying more to replace other flashlights I have.
customer_reviews.author: Derek King

customer_reviews.title: Good light, no kidding
customer_reviews.text: Hey guys, this is a no bullshit flashlight. I've been wasting money on flashlights for 20yrs just to save a buck, I'll give you my word it's worth buying, if you cool with 1000lm+and no focus. I'm good with that, and the battery life is unreal (with good high drain), the only complaint I have, is really the mode button near the bezel. It's perfectly rounded, smooth and fits the profile so well its hard to locate, put sand paper on mine, problem solved
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and a slim design.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of it’s intensity and the slim design. I purchased a similar product from a different manufacturer last year. After being dropped a few times the old one simply quit. I’m hoping that this one is more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Will temporally blind an assailant if you point it at his/her face. The flashing mode will disorient immediately. Gets the job done very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Shea

customer_reviews.title: Fenix Flashlights FX-PD35TAC Flashlight, 1000 Lumen, Black
customer_reviews.text: Fenix Flashlights FX-PD35TAC Flashlight, 1000 Lumen, Black is the best flashlight I have found on the market nothing comes close to the Fenix flashlight, they are ultra bright and the batteries last a long time and are rechargable !!
customer_reviews.author: JLooneyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Overall, great product.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is smaller than the uc model. I do not like that when I ordered this, it was not clear that the rechargeable batteries were sold separately. I also do not like that the method to change the brightness/strobe mode is done by half depressing the tailcap. This makes it so when clearing a room you have to leave the light on constantly which exposes your position.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Fenix Flashlights FX-PD35TAC Flashlight, 1000 Lumen, Black, 5.5 in
product_meta.description: Size:5.5 inThe Fenix PD35 TAC (Tactical Edition) remains a pocket size tactical flashlight but has a higher performance and focuses on tactical employment, compared to its predecessor the Fenix PD35. Fenix has taken the all-time bestselling PD35 LED flashlight and added some innovative user features to enhance its tactical capabilities. Measured at less than 5.51 inches, the Fenix PD35 Tac flashlight features a 1000 lumen max output and has a beam distance of up to 656 feet. The Fenix PD35 TAC runs of a single 18650 battery or two CR123A batteries. The Fenix PD35 TAC features two general modes: Tactical Mode and Outdoor Mode. In the Outdoor Mode, the Fenix PD35 Tactical Edition delivers up to 6 output modes for maximum functionality. However, the Tactical Mode strengthens the PD35 TAC with simplified and faster operation. Perfect for outdoor use, professional use, security, & law enforcement, you can count on the PD35 TAC delivering reliable and powerful lighting for a wide range of situations. Features New Cree XP-L LED provides up to 251% performance boost from XP-G2 LED Modes of Operation TACTICAL MODE Turbo: 1000 Lumens Low: 60 Lumens Strobe: 1000 Lumens OUTDOOR MODE Turbo: 1000 Lumens High: 500 Lumens Mid: 200 Lumens Low: 60 Lumens Eco: 8 Lumens Strobe: 1000 Lumens Side switch for mode changing under Outdoor Mode Advanced Digitally regulated output maintains constant brightness Low-voltage reminder indicates when battery replacement is needed Reverse polarity protection, to protect from improper battery installation Made of durable aircraft-grade aluminum Premium Type III hard-anodized anti-abrasive finish Toughened ultra-clear glass lens with anti-reflective coating Waterproof to IPX-8 standard, underwater up to 6 1/2 feet for 30 min
